sentence: Recognizing that the retail payment infrastructure touches every American, a year ago, the Federal Reserve committed to build its first major new payment system in four decades.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the Federal Reserve's commitment to build a new payment system, which does not directly impact the stance of monetary policy.

sentence: At that time, no one anticipated the challenges our nation would soon face.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it does not provide any information or implications related to the stance of the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC). It reflects on past events and does not indicate a hawkish, dovish, or neutral stance on monetary policy.

sentence: 1The COVID-19 pandemic is taking a tremendous toll on communities across America, especially households and small businesses with the least liquid resources to weather the storm.2 Emergency relief payments authorized in the Coronavirus Aid, Relief, and Economic Security Act, or CARES Act, provided a vital lifeline for many households.3 The rapid expenditure of the COVID emergency relief payments highlights the critical urgency of immediate access to funds for the many households and businesses managing cash-flow constraints.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it focuses on the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on communities and the importance of emergency relief payments. It does not provide any indication of the stance of the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) towards monetary policy, whether hawkish, dovish, or neutral.

sentence: After sharply reducing their spending early in the COVID crisis, many households increased their spending starting on the day they received the emergency relief payments and continued for the following 10 days.4 The rapid increase in spending was greatest for households with lower incomes, greater income declines, and lower liquid savings.5The urgency with which the emergency payments were spent underscores the importance of rapid access to funds for many households and businesses that face cash flow constraints.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it focuses on the spending behavior of households during the COVID crisis and the importance of rapid access to funds. It does not provide any indication of the stance of the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) regarding interest rates or other monetary policy tools.

sentence: The Federal Reserve, acting as Fiscal Agent for the U.S. Department of the Treasury, processed most of the CARES Act payments to households using direct deposit, prepaid debit cards, and checks, which can take several days between the time the funds are sent and the time recipients get access to their funds.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the operational details of how the Federal Reserve processed CARES Act payments. It does not provide any indication of a hawkish, dovish, or neutral stance on monetary policy.

sentence: By contrast, the ability to disburse funds via instant payments could have helped reduce the strain for those who needed the funds quickly in order to meet financial obligations.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the ability to disburse funds via instant payments, which does not directly relate to the stance of the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) on interest rates or other monetary policy tools.

sentence: The same is true for other payments intended to provide immediate assistance, for example, in the wake of natural disasters.In good times as well as bad, instant payments will enable millions of American households and small businesses to get instant access to funds, rather than waiting days for checks to clear.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the benefits of instant payments for American households and small businesses, without any direct implications on the stance of monetary policy.

sentence: An instant payment infrastructure ensures the funds are available immediately, which could be especially important for households on fixed incomes or living paycheck to paycheck, when waiting days for the funds to be available to pay a bill can mean overdraft fees or late fees that can compound, or reliance on costly sources of credit.
reason: This sentence suggests that an instant payment infrastructure is beneficial for households with fixed incomes or living paycheck to paycheck, as it helps avoid overdraft fees or reliance on expensive credit. However, it does not directly indicate any stance on US monetary policy, making it irrelevant in that context.

sentence: For small businesses, the ability to receive customer payments instantly could help them manage cash flows when working capital is tied up in materials or inventory.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the benefits of small businesses receiving customer payments instantly to manage cash flows. It does not provide any indication of a hawkish, dovish, or neutral stance on monetary policy.

sentence:
And for the 1 in 10 Americans who regularly work in the gig economy, getting immediate access to the payments for their work could help address cash-flow constraints when money is tight.6FedNowSM Service
Consumers and businesses across the country want and expect instant payments, and the banks they trust should be able to provide this service securely.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the need for instant payments in the gig economy and the expectation for banks to provide secure services. It does not provide any indication of a hawkish, dovish, or neutral stance on monetary policy.

sentence: One year ago, the Federal Reserve announced we would build the FedNow Service to enable banks of every size and in every community in America to provide safe and efficient instant payment services around the clock, every day of the year.7 The FedNow Service will facilitate end-to-end instant payment services for consumers and businesses, increase competition, and ensure equitable access to banks of all sizes nationwide.The Federal Reserve is uniquely positioned to build an instant payment infrastructure, given our long history of operating payment systems to promote a safe, efficient, and broadly accessible payment infrastructure.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the Federal Reserve's plan to build the FedNow Service, which is focused on improving payment services and increasing competition. It does not provide any indication of the Fed's stance on interest rates or its monetary policy approach.

sentence: The decision to build an instant payment infrastructure reflected support from a broad set of stakeholders, including the vast majority of over 400 commenters that responded to the Board's 2018 notice, as well as the U.S. Treasury.8 Our public mission in providing payment services is built on the proposition that all banks and the communities they serve, no matter their size or geographic location, should have equitable access to the U.S. payment system.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the decision to build an instant payment infrastructure and the mission of providing payment services. It does not provide any indication of a hawkish, dovish, or neutral stance on monetary policy.

sentence: Through the direct connections that we have with more than 10,000 banks, the FedNow Service will be broadly accessible to banks and the communities they serve across the country.The FedNow Service will not only expand but also strengthen the U.S. payment infrastructure by operating alongside the private-sector instant payment service, the Clearing House's RTP network.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the implementation and accessibility of the FedNow Service, which is a payment infrastructure initiative. It does not provide any indication of the stance or implications on US monetary policy, such as being hawkish, dovish, or neutral.

sentence: As they do for other payment services, many banks may choose to maintain access to more than one instant payment service to attain resiliency through redundancy.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the decision of banks to maintain access to multiple payment services for resiliency purposes. It does not provide any indication of a hawkish, dovish, or neutral stance on monetary policy.

sentence: Moreover, the Federal Reserve has always had a vital role in the payment system by providing liquidity and operational continuity in times of stress, and the FedNow Service will extend this role directly into the instant payment market.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the Federal Reserve's role in the payment system and the introduction of the FedNow Service, which does not directly impact the monetary policy stance.

sentence:
The presence of more than one service provider also brings the efficiency benefits associated with competition and benefits consumers, according to analysis from the U.S. Government Accountability Office.9The First Year of Progress
Since last August, the Federal Reserve has made substantial strides in developing the FedNow Service, including on the evaluation of prototypes of the core clearing and settlement functionality.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the efficiency benefits of competition and the progress made by the Federal Reserve in developing the FedNow Service. It does not provide any indication of a hawkish, dovish, or neutral stance on monetary policy.

sentence: Across the Federal Reserve System, work has continued apace, commensurate with the high priority of the initiative, even as we have mobilized an unprecedented response to the COVID-19 shock.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it does not provide any indication or implications regarding the stance of the Federal Reserve. It primarily focuses on the ongoing work within the Federal Reserve System and the response to the COVID-19 shock, without expressing any hawkish, dovish, or neutral views.

sentence: We have a team of over 100 people working on the program, including experts drawn from across the Federal Reserve System and key external hires.Since we initiated the FedNow Service one year ago, we have been meeting our project milestones, and today I am pleased to announce the Federal Reserve Board has approved the core features and functionality based on extensive input from stakeholders.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it does not provide any information or implications regarding the stance of the Federal Reserve. It primarily discusses the team and progress of the FedNow Service, without addressing any monetary policy decisions or implications.

sentence: In addition to the core interbank clearing and settlement functionality that will enable consumers and businesses to send and receive instant payments through participating banks, the FedNow Service will include features that enhance the usability of the service.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the features and functionality of the FedNow Service, which is a payment system. It does not provide any indication of a hawkish, dovish, or neutral stance on monetary policy.

sentence: We heard loud and clear from stakeholders the primary importance of getting this service to the market as quickly as possible.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it does not provide any information or implications related to the stance of the Federal Reserve. It focuses on the importance of expediting a service to the market, which is unrelated to monetary policy decisions.

sentence: To meet this goal, we are announcing a phased approach that will enable the FedNow Service to get to market expeditiously with a core set of features and to expand available features over time in response to changes in technology and market needs.Let me highlight several key features of the initial service offering.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it does not provide any information or implications regarding the stance of the Federal Reserve. It focuses on the phased approach and expansion of features for the FedNow Service, which does not directly relate to the monetary policy stance.

sentence: First, we heard strong support for fraud tools within the FedNow Service to support banks' efforts to mitigate the risk of fraud with instant payments.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the implementation of fraud tools within the FedNow Service, which is unrelated to the monetary policy stance. It does not provide any implications on whether the policy is hawkish, dovish, or neutral.

sentence: Accordingly, upon implementation, banks will be able proactively to set parameters that limit transaction activity in the FedNow Service based on banks' knowledge of their own customers.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the implementation of parameters for transaction activity in the FedNow Service by banks. It does not provide any indication of a hawkish, dovish, or neutral stance on monetary policy.

sentence: As we gain insights from banks' experience with the initial set of fraud tools, we will explore other tools that may be valuable, including centralized monitoring by the FedNow Service.Second, banks told us they want to be able to ensure they have adequate funds in their Federal Reserve accounts on a 24x7x365 basis to cover outflows related to instant payments, especially during hours when existing payment services are not open and funds cannot be transferred into Federal Reserve accounts to cover intraday overdrafts.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the implementation of fraud tools and the need for banks to have adequate funds for instant payments. It does not provide any indication of a hawkish, dovish, or neutral stance on monetary policy.

sentence: Accordingly, we will develop a liquidity management tool that allows a participant with excess funds in its Federal Reserve account to transfer funds to another participant who needs the funds on weekends, holidays, and after hours.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the development of a liquidity management tool for transferring funds between participants in the Federal Reserve system during weekends, holidays, and after hours.

sentence: Moreover, we will make the liquidity management tool available for instant payments broadly, including to banks that choose not to participate in the FedNow Service.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the availability of a liquidity management tool for instant payments, which does not directly impact the stance of the Federal Reserve. It does not provide any indication of a hawkish, dovish, or neutral stance.

sentence: Participants in a private-sector instant payments service will be able to use the tool to transfer funds from their Federal Reserve accounts to the joint account at a Reserve Bank that backs settlement in that service.Third, it will be important for the FedNow Service to be interoperable with the private-sector instant payment service to accomplish the goal of nationwide reach for instant payments.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the technical aspects of a private-sector instant payments service and its interoperability with the FedNow Service. It does not provide any indication of a hawkish, dovish, or neutral stance on monetary policy.

sentence: In part to facilitate interoperability, the FedNow Service design will use the widely accepted ISO 20022 message standard and other industry best practices.10 To the extent other instant payment services fully adopt the same publicly available, widely accepted standards, this approach would enable a form of interoperability where banks can route payments through either the FedNow Service or other instant payment services based on the available path to the receiver.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the technical aspects of the FedNow Service design and interoperability standards. It does not provide any indication of a hawkish, dovish, or neutral stance on monetary policy.

sentence: We are also open to collaborating on a form of interoperability where messages can be exchanged between the FedNow Service and private-sector instant payment service operators, similar to the approach used in automated clearinghouse (ACH) systems.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses potential collaboration on interoperability between the FedNow Service and private-sector instant payment service operators, which does not directly impact the hawkish, dovish, or neutral stance of the monetary policy.

sentence: Implementing this approach would significantly increase the required level of commitment and active engagement of the private-sector instant payment service operator from the outset.In order to minimize time to market, additional features of the FedNow Service would be introduced in phases after launch.
reason: This sentence suggests a hawkish stance on US monetary policy. The implementation of this approach indicates a significant increase in the commitment and engagement of the private-sector instant payment service operator. Additionally, the introduction of additional features in phases after launch aims to minimize time to market, indicating a proactive and assertive approach.

sentence: But providing this feature securely requires addressing legal, operational, and security challenges that would increase the time to market for the core service.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the challenges of providing a secure feature, which does not directly impact the stance of the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) regarding interest rates or other monetary policy tools.

sentence:
Balancing these considerations, we will explore the best ways to add a directory service or other approach to alias-based payments with the goal of providing this feature as a high priority following the initial launch.The Road Ahead
As we proceed with the development of the FedNow Service, we will continue our engagement with a broad set of stakeholders to gain input on desired features and to work with banks and their service providers on preparations to adopt the service.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the development of the FedNow Service and engagement with stakeholders, without providing any indication of the stance on interest rates or the overall direction of monetary policy.

sentence: In May, the Federal Reserve Banks announced the formation of the FedNow Community for stakeholders who would like to help inform the development of the FedNow Service.11 The Community currently has over 500 members from all segments of the payment ecosystem.

sentence: We are working with service providers, recognizing their importance in providing essential payment processing services for thousands of banks in this country.

sentence: We are also engaging directly with the fintech and software companies who provide customer-facing services that will help banks build innovative instant payment products to serve their communities.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses engagement with fintech and software companies for the purpose of developing instant payment products. It does not provide any indication of a hawkish, dovish, or neutral stance on monetary policy.

sentence: The readiness of these stakeholders to support banks' participation in the FedNow Service and expand potential uses through value-added services is key to widespread adoption of instant payments.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it focuses on stakeholders' readiness to support banks' participation in the FedNow Service and expand potential uses through value-added services, which does not directly impact the monetary policy stance of being hawkish, dovish, or neutral.

sentence: We look forward to our continued partnership with banks and other stakeholders in this transformative initiative to deliver a safe and efficient instant payment system with national reach.It has been an eventful year for retail payments with technology players introducing new business models and accelerating the pace of digitalization.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses retail payments and technology players, which are not directly related to the monetary policy decisions made by the FOMC.

sentence: As the central bank, our focus on the safety and integrity of the payment system means we need to ensure that payment innovations do not come at the cost of security, reliability, or consumer protections.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it primarily addresses the central bank's focus on the safety and integrity of the payment system, emphasizing the need to balance payment innovations with security, reliability, and consumer protections. sentence: Some newer payment services, while providing what has the look and feel of an instant payment experience for consumers, in fact rely on legacy infrastructure that actually settles transactions on a deferred basis, creating risk for consumers, banks, and the payment system overall.
reason: This sentence highlights the risks associated with newer payment services that appear to offer instant payment experiences but actually rely on legacy infrastructure with deferred settlement. It implies a concern for consumer protection, banking stability, and the overall payment system. However, it is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it does not directly address interest rates or the stance of the Federal Reserve.

sentence: In contrast, the FedNow Service will offer real-time gross settlement of transactions, an approach that involves each transaction being processed individually and immediately, which avoids interbank credit risk.Efforts by global stablecoin networks such as Facebook's Libra project to drive the next stage of payment innovation have raised other fundamental questions about legal and regulatory safeguards, financial stability, and the appropriate role of private money.12 The Federal Reserve remains optimistic about the power of technology and innovation to deliver payments safely, immediately, and efficiently when the appropriate safeguards are in place.13 We are committed to building an instant payment system that delivers the payment speed that users want without bypassing the legal and regulatory protections they have come to expect from banking relationships.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the FedNow Service and global stablecoin networks, which are not directly related to the monetary policy stance of the Federal Reserve.

sentence: Ultimately, the FedNow Service can be a catalyst for innovation in the market by providing a neutral platform on which the private sector can build to offer safe, efficient instant payment services to users across the country.
reason: This sentence suggests that the FedNow Service, by providing a neutral platform, can encourage innovation in the market for safe and efficient instant payment services. However, it does not directly indicate any specific implications on US monetary policy, making it irrelevant in terms of its impact on monetary policy.

sentence: The promise of the FedNow Service is that it will provide a modern payment infrastructure for the future, bringing the benefits of instant payments to communities across America and improving the way households, businesses, and government agencies make payments for many years to come. 1.
